data.body:
When call `setCapInsets`, the Scale9Sprite's inner sprite will be
rebuild and it's state will be lose.

This commit reset the shader state.

data.title: PolygonSprite operation invalid.
data.body:
related pr: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/12841

some APIs must be re-checked:
- [x] setColor: Fix at #12863 
- [x] setOpacity: Fix at #12863
- [x] setTexture: Fix at #12863
- [x] setTextureRect:Fix at #12863
- [x] setPosition: OK
- [x] setAnchorPoint: OK
- [x] setScale: OK
- [x] setFlip: Fix at #13138
- [x] setSkew: OK
- [x] setRotation: OK
- [ ] SpriteBatchNode: Doesn't support, please using auto-batch instead. 
- [x] SpriteFrame: OK

data.title: [ci skip]Update requirements info
cc.textureCache.addImageAsync is not fully asynchronous
data.body:
Currently we have cc.textureCache.addImageAsync to load online image with url which is async.

But after downloaded image, it will invoke Image::initWithImageData to create the texture which will blocking the main thread and cause freeze.

Thus, the whole process is not fully asynchronous as Image::initWithImageData is synchronous.

In this case, i would like to request implementation of Image::initWithImageDataAsync to make the loading image process fully asynchronous.

The original issue cc.textureCache.addImageAsync is at here :
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-js/issues/1217

From @pandamicro 

> Do we must invoke Image::initWithImageData after the image data downloaded to buffer?

For image data downloaded to buffer, yes.
For image downloaded to file, no, we can use other APIs.

> Why the frozen issue is not happen on Mac but only Android and iOS?

CCImage implementation is in the platform folder, so it's platform related and its performance may vary between different platforms

Thanks.

[ci skip] v3.7 rc1 release doc
EditBox now calls EditBoxDelegate::editBoxReturn only when return button is pressed on iOS and OS X
data.body:
Right now, the `editBoxEditingDidEnd` and `editBoxReturn` methods are called simultaneously.
This pull request makes `editBoxReturn` be called only after `return` button is pressed on iOS and OS X.

data.title: Improving iOS EditBox Implementation
data.body:
I will be making a series of commits to improve the implementation of EditBox on iOS. I will focus on better code style and conventions that match Apple's ObjC convention, but will also see if I can optimize the implementation a bit, and resolve a few bugs:

https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/10777
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/11732
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/12519

@zilongshanren This is as we discussed. Please let me know of any updates from your side

data.title: SpriteFrame rect offset changing on device, with textures exported from TexturePacker.
data.body:
I encountered this problem when I started cutting the level in my game in to smaller peices. I am using a sprite atlas exported from TexturePacker. If I move my Cocos2d::Camera (orthographic) in the Y axis the rect for each sprite frame appears to be changing its offset 1 by pixel. It doesn't happen consistently every frame, but maybe every 4-5 frames. 
There is a visible offset of the spriteframe and I know the rect is changing because I can see the first line of pixels from the frame above that particular frame in the sprite atlas is getting drawn. I've tried every option in TexturePacker and I'm convinced that's not the problem. I'm 99% it's something going wrong in the Cocos2D-x engine.

It should be fairly simple to reproduce, export a texture pack (sprite atlas) with a few images. Run it on a device, I used iPhone 4S. Then move the camera every frame on the y-axis, I moved it up (+0.1f). I have also tested it on an Android device (Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 10.1) and it still happens.

It's worth mentioning the problem appears to go away if running on the iOS simulator or in Win32, hopefully that may help to fix it. 

It's also worth mentioning that the problem appears to happen rather sporadically, i.e. it has no set pattern. My first thought was floating point innacuracies in the shader or something.

data.title: Label:Fixed draw incorrectly with Simsun font if font size lower than 19.
fix Sprite::setColor() not working with AutoPolygon
data.body: When setting the color on a Sprite initialized with a PolygonInfo, the internal Sprite _polyInfo is not updated from the _quad. Therefore, it has no effect when the sprite is drawn.
